article: In a class I teach for adults, I recently did the "unpardonable." I gave the class homework! The assignment was to "go to someone you love _ the next week and tell them you love them.It has to to be someone you have never _ those words to before or at least haven't shared those words with for a long time." That doesn't _ like a very tough assignment, _ you stop to realize that most of the men were over 35 and were _ ." Showing feelings or crying (heaven forbid!) was just not done _ this was a very threatening assignment for some. At the _ of our next class, I asked if someone wanted to _ what happened when they told someone they loved them.I fully expected one of the _ to volunteer, as was usually the _ , but on this evening one of the men raised his hand.He appeared quite moved and a bit _ .As he unfolded out of his chair, he began by saying, "Dennis.I was quite _ with you last week when you gave us the assignment.I didn't think that I had _ to say those words to and _ , who were you to tell me to do something that personal? But as I began driving home my conscience started talking to me.It was telling me that I _ exactly who I needed to say I love you to.You see, five years ago, my father and I had a heated _ and really never resolved it since that one.We _ seeing each other unless we absolutely had to at Christmas or other family gatherings.But _ then, we hardly spoke to each other.So last.Tuesday by the time I got home, I had convinced myself.I was going to tell my father I loved him."
